sentence.Network_en: These developments were foreseen in embryo more than a decade ago.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些发展早在十多年前的萌芽阶段就已预见到。

sentence.Network_en: Breakfast television arrived in British life precisely a decade ago.
sentence.Network_cn: 准确地说，早间电视节目于10年前进入英国人的生活。

sentence.Network_en: A decade later, the company has gone from strength to strength.
sentence.Network_cn: 十年后，该公司已经逐渐壮大。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting each of ten parts of a literary work): via Old French and late Latin from Greek deka 'ten'. Sense 1 dates from the early 17th cent

entry.tran: 十年，十年期（尤指一个年代)
entry.def: A decade is a period of ten years, especially one that begins with a year ending in 0, for example 1980 to 1989.

example.ex: ...the last decade of the nineteenth century.

means.word_mean: 2. the cardinal number that is the sum of nine and one; the base of the decimal system

auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is the worst violence in almost a decade.

Sentence.sentence: What it does mean is that the book business will go through a transformation in the next decade or so more profound than any it has seen since Gutenberg introduced printing from moveable type in the 1450s.

Decades ago, Kodak anticipated that digital photography would overtake film — and in fact, Kodak invented the first digital camera in 1975 — but in a fateful decision, the company chose to shelf its new discovery to focus on its traditional film business.
Kodak's downfall over the last several decades was dramatic
So we have a great amount of time for leisure than in decades past.
Apple stands to win as well, hooking more young consumers with decades of technology purchases ahead of them.

Each group over the coming decades will need to address different issues surrounding food production, storage and transportation, as well as consumer expectations, if we are to continue to feed all our people.

means.word_mean: 十年, 十年间，十年期（尤指一个年代）

sentences.en: Prices have risen steadily during the past decade.
sentences.cn: 过去的十年间, 物价一直在上涨。

jushi.english: The world will considerably change in the next few decades.
jushi.chinese: 世界在今后数十年里将有相当大的变化。

jushi.english: The last decade of the eighteenth century was a time of great social change.
jushi.chinese: 18世纪最后10年是社会发生巨变的10年。

jushi.english: Several decades have elapsed since I graduated from the college.
jushi.chinese: 自我大学毕业已经好几十年了。
